topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556c55576368720c59d40900#post_556c55576368720c59d40900
Eeyup.

There's a lot of weird science experiments out there that make the average person's stomach turn.

Did I ever tell you the experiment where they had a actor pretending to be electrocuted and a line of actors all in on it pressing a fake button to electrocute the person behind the curtain and the person who is the test subject believed that he was electrocuting someone and a fair number of subjects continued the test even after the actor pretended to be dead?  I think it was called the Milgram experiment?  It was interesting because it showed that average people would be willing to kill a innocent person simply because they were told to.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Weird Science: Medicine

One of the early treatments for insanity was to transfuse the blood of the patient with that of a cow. It is believed that the docile nature of the cow would water down the 'crazy blood' of the patient...

Bloodborne!
